sentences: He is signed to ByStorm Entertainment/RCA Records and released Eldorado, his first album under a major label, in 2016.
Born in Stuttgart, West Germany, James is of Panamanian and African-American descent.
He eventually moved to New York where he was influenced by his aunt Rosie Gaines, a former singer for Prince.
James performed in and around New York with artists such as Luke James and Wynter Gordon.
In 2013 he released his first EP, a three-part entitled Coke, Jack and Cadillacs.

James signed with ByStorm Entertainment/RCA Records in 2015 and subsequently released "Permission", his first single from a major record label, reaching number 37 on the US Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart.
His debut album, Eldorado was released May 27, 2016.
It subsequently earned him his first nomination for Best R&B Performance at the 59th Grammy Awards in February 2017.
The R&B Tour (with BJ The Chicago Kid) (2018)
